quotes.quote: The lurking suspicion that something could be simplified is the world's richest source of rewarding challenges.
The suspicious mind believes more than it doubts. It believes in a formidable and ineradicable evil lurking in every person.
Once you get over the first hill, there is always a new, higher one lurking, of course.
There’s something about shadows because you make your own mind up about what’s lurking in them.
A lurking pun is the worst pun, one the offender has been waiting to spring on you.
The scariest monsters are the ones that lurk within our souls...
Always check your hats before donning them. You never know what might be lurking inside.
True monsters are not those lurking under the bed, but the ones sleeping in it.
What would an ocean be without a monster lurking in the dark? It would be like sleep without dreams.
Every man has a lurking wish to appear considerable in his native place.
Behind every successful man lurks a truly amazed ex-mother-in-law.
Tomorrow lurks in us, the latency to be all that was not achieved before.
I feel that there is reason lurking in you somewhere, so we will patiently grope round for it.
There is a lurking fear that some things are not 'meant' to be known, that some inquiries are too dangerous for human beings to make.
Whatever may be the tensions and the stresses of a particular day, there is always lurking close at hand the trailing beauty of forgotten joy or unremembered peace.

Truth is what every man sees lurking at the bottom of his own soul, like the oyster shell housewives put in the kitchen kettle to collect the lime from the water. By and by each man’s iridescent oyster shell of Truth becomes coated with the lime of prejudice and hearsay.
Let all the poisons that lurk in the mud, Hatch out.
In every cradle decked with rosy wreath lurk germs of death.

We live in a world of constant juxtaposition between joy that's possible and pain that's all too common. We hope for love and success and abundance, but we never quite forget that there is always lurking the possibility of disaster.
There's no love more intense than the love we have for our kids - and where there is intense love, there is also intense fear lurking beneath the surface.
In their vanity men focus on what they wish to hear and miss the hidden meaning, the lurking threat.
'Lurking' is one metaphor that the Omniscience has allowed us to borrow.
There's a snake lurking in the grass.
Failure is the foundation of success: success is the lurking place of failure.
Reality is like a fruitcake; pretty enough to look at but with all sorts of nasty things lurking just beneath the surface.
